resources.title: If You're Arrested: A Step-By-Step Guide
resources.step1.title: Step 1. Stay Calm and Know Your Rights
resources.step1.detail1: You have the right to remain silent.
resources.step1.detail2: Say only whatâ€™s required: your name, date of birth, and address. You do not have to answer other questions without a lawyer.
resources.step1.detail3: Ask politely: â€œAm I being detained, or am I free to go?â€
resources.step2.title: Step 2. Request Legal Counsel Immediately
resources.step2.detail1: You have the right to a lawyer. If you canâ€™t afford one, the court can appoint one for you.
resources.step2.detail2: Tell officers you are invoking your right to remain silent until you speak with your lawyer.
resources.step2.detail3: Your lawyer must meet you privately and keep your information confidential.
resources.step2.detail4: Your lawyer can provide an interpreter if needed.

resources.step3.title: Step 3. During Interrogation
resources.step3.detail1: Use a clear script: â€œIâ€™m choosing to remain silent and would like to speak with my lawyer.â€
resources.step3.detail2: Do not sign anything or give statements without legal advice. If pressured, repeat your request for co-unsel.
resources.step4.title: Your lawyerâ€™s role (what you should expect)
resources.step4.subdetail1: Contact you promptly (typically within 4 working days, charges may affect timing).
resources.step4.subdetail2: Speak with your family if you want.
resources.step4.subdetail3: Learn your story, review evidence, and talk to witnesses for you.
resources.step4.subdetail4: Seek release with the fewest conditions possible.
resources.step4.subdetail5: Explain your charges, court dates, your right to a trial, and case progress.
resources.step4.subdetail6: Be honest, even with difficult news.
resources.step4.detail2: If these basics arenâ€™t happening, you can ask the judge for a new lawyer
resources.step5.title: Step 5. Decisions you can make with your lawyer
resources.step5.detail1: Go to trial or take a plea.
resources.step5.detail3: Choose a judge or jury trial.
resources.step5.detail5: Request fee waivers if you canâ€™t afford court costs.

resources.checklist.title: Quick Rights Checklist
resources.checklist.point1.title: Right to counsel
resources.checklist.point1.detail: You have the right to a lawyer. If you cannot afford one, the court will appoint one for you.
resources.checklist.point2.title: Right to remain silent
resources.checklist.point2.detail: You do not have to answer questions without a lawyer present..
resources.checklist.point3.title: Confidentiality
resources.checklist.point3.detail: Your lawyer must meet you privately and keep your information confidential.
resources.checklist.point4.title: Interpreter Access
resources.checklist.point4.detail: Your lawyer can provide an interpreter if needed.
